foods.name: Asam Udeng
foods.description: Asam Udeung is a typical Aceh dish made from boiled shrimp that is chopped into small pieces and seasoned with sour and spicy spices. Asam Udeung is popularly known as ‘sambal ganja’. This is not at all because this food contains marijuana, but because this chili sauce makes people addicted to it.

steps: Steam the prawns until they change colour, remove from heat.
Mix the prawns with ground spices, lime leaves, and sliced chilies. Stir well.
Ready to serve

foods.name: Ayam Tangkap
foods.description: Captured chicken is a typical Aceh Besar food, made from fried chicken with green chilies and Teumuru leaves or Salam Koja or Curry Leaves. Captured chicken is usually served with sweet soy sauce mixed with chopped onions and chilies as a dipping sauce.

steps: Knead chicken with ground spices and tamarind water, drain after 15 minutes.
Heat 200 ml of cooking oil. Add half the chicken, fry half cooked, remove.
Fry the rest is also half cooked.
Mix all the chicken with the remaining ingredients, mix well.
Over medium heat, fry all ingredients and chicken until golden brown.
Lift and drain.
Serve with fried curry/temuru leaves

foods.name: Anyang Daun
foods.description: Anyang daun, which is a food consisting of fern leaves, bean sprouts, ground spices and grated coconut. Its appearance is almost like the urap that Javanese people usually call it, but it is very different, starting from the ingredients and the spices used are very different.

steps: Roast grated coconut until brown. Finely ground without being greasy.
Mix well with ground spices and lime flesh.
Boil cassava leaves together with papaya leaves until cooked. Drain well.
Cut according to taste. Together with bean sprouts mixed with seasoned grated coconut.
Ready to Serve

foods.name: Rendang
foods.description: Rendang is a meat dish originating from Minangkabau, West Sumatra, Indonesia. The process of cooking rendang at low temperatures for a long time, using coconut milk and a variety of typical Indonesian spices, which is slightly spicy, adds to its uniqueness and delicacy.

steps: Bring light coconut milk to a boil with ground spices and turmeric leaves.
Add meat, bring to a boil.
Reduce the heat, and cook until the meat is tender, pour in the thick coconut milk
Cook again with asam kandis and stir occasionally.
After the coconut milk thickens and becomes oily, turn off the heat
Rendang is ready to be served

foods.name: Slada Padang
foods.description: Slada Padang is one of the best dishes from the Minangkabau area of Padang, West Sumatra. This one menu is usually present during important events there, such as a salvation event or Eid al-Fitr. The cuisine originally comes from the Netherlands which is then processed into Minang-flavored dishes.

steps: Arrange cucumber, lettuce, egg white pieces, tomato, and potato chips in a serving bowl.
Pour the sauce, mix well.
Serve with sprinkles

items.name: Chicken Egg
items.description: Boiled, peeled, separate the whites and yolks, set aside the yolks for the sauce, thinly slice the whites

items.name: Red Tomato
items.description: Seeds removed, cut into 2 cm dice

items.name: Potato
items.description: Peeled, thinly sliced, fried until crispy

foods.name: Timpan
foods.description: Timpan cake is one of the typical foods from Aceh. This sweet snack made from glutinous rice flour has become a favourite food for the Acehnese people on major Islamic holidays such as holidays. In addition to big days, Kue Timpan is also often found at parties, social gatherings and other important banquets held in Acehnese society.

steps: Make the skin dough first with the input of glutinous rice flour and bananas that have been mashed previously in one container, stir until well blended.
Pour in the thick coconut milk, whiting water, and salt, stir until thoroughly mixed. Then set aside.
Next to make the filling, mix the chicken eggs and granulated sugar using a mixer until thick.
Add the flour and thick coconut milk while stirring until evenly distributed.
Enter the cooked jackfruit that has been chopped, grated young coconut and pandan leaves, stir until blended and cook until thickened.
Remove and add vanilla powder while stirring well.
Prepare a banana leaf, cut it to the size of the timpan cake and brush it with oil.
Take enough skin dough and then thin it over a banana leaf that has been given oil.
Then roll and wrap neatly, arrange in the steamer and steam for 10 minutes or until cooked.
Remove the timpan cake and serve in a container

foods.name: Brenebon Soup
foods.description: Brenebon is a soup from the Netherlands. Its name comes from the Dutch language, namely Bruine Bonen, Bruine means Brown (Brown Color) and Bonen means Peanut, which means Brown / red beans. Brenebon is one of the typical dishes from North Sulawesi.  Usually, to strengthen the taste of the brenebon soup, which is originally bland, Indonesian spices are added such as nutmeg, cloves, garlic and pepper.

steps: Bring the water to boil, add the meat. Skim the foam.
Add red beans, bring to a boil again
Reduce heat, cook until meat and red beans are cooked and tender. While continuing to Skim the foam.
Sauté shallots with margarine until browned, mix with meat broth.
Add salt, nutmeg, pepper, and tomatoes. Keep cooking on low heat until the red beans and meat crumble if you touch them with your fingers.
Add boiling water if you feel the water is lacking.
Before removing, take 1 tablespoon of red beans and crush them. Then put it back into the soup.
Add the scallions and celery and a sprinkling of fried shallot
Ready to be served.

foods.name: Melon Sago
foods.description: Sago Melon is a dessert which is a combination of Sago Pearl, Melon balls, Melon Juice and coconut milk. Included in the cold dessert category. One light dessert that can complement any type of heavy meal.

steps: Boil the water in a pot then add tapioca pearls, stir it once while cooked. After it is cooked, chill it for a moment.
Prepare another pan and boil the water then add coconut milk on it after that add the sugar and salt too. After it is cooked, chill it for a moment.
After all is done, mix them in the bowl then add the honey dew melon in it.
Serve it on the cup

foods.name: Bok Choy Singaporean Style
foods.description: It is a side dish. Can accompany meat, chicken or fish and seafood dishes.

steps: Sauté garlic and lemon grass than add oyster sauce
Add bok choy  than season with salt and pepper

foods.name: Bo Xao Xa (Vietnam)
foods.description: Main course from Vietnam which is made from beef. The cooking technique used is Saute. Served with steam white rice, and can also include vegetable side dish

steps: Sauté garlic and onion
Add the sliced beef
Add lemon grass
Put the red chili together into the pan
Add fish sauce, sugar, salt, and crack black pepper
Stir it well until it’s mix
Add cornstarch
Simmer to make the beef even more tender
Served with plain rice and garnish it with roasted peanuts and cilantro

items.name: Cornstarch
items.description: mix with water as thickening agent

foods.name: Lumpia Semarang
foods.description: A typical snack from Semarang, Central Java, which was first introduced in the 19th century.  Lumpia is an Indonesian food that is influenced by Chinese culture.  The name spring roll or lunpia comes from the Hokkien dialect, 'lun' or 'lum' means soft and 'pia' means cake. In the beginning, Semarang spring rolls were not fried, so in accordance with the meaning of spring rolls, soft cakes.  There are two types of spring rolls in Semarang, namely ‘basah’ and ‘goreng’. This typical Semarang dish has a delicious taste and a crunchy texture.  The sweet taste of spring rolls adapts to the taste that the local people like.

steps: With 5 tablespoons of oil, fry the ebi until fragrant. Side a side
Sauté the garlic with the remaining oil, stir-fry until fragrant, add the tauco, chicken, shrimp. Stir until the meat is half cooked.
Pour 1 liter of water, add ebi and all remaining ingredients except eggs. Cook on low heat until the water runs out.
Add the scrambled eggs, stir until the bamboo shoots are slightly dry. Remove and cool
Roll the stuffing with spring roll skin, apply the sauce to glue the skin. Fry spring rolls until golden brown in spring roll
Bring water, brown sugar and garlic to a boil.
Add flower lawing, add salt and strain.
Bring to a boil again and thicken with corn/sago flour.

items.name: Bamboo Shoots
items.description: ready to process, cut into fine julienne

foods.name: Rawon
foods.description: Rawon is a typical black soup from East Java. Rawon is a food made from various herbs, spices, and pieces of beef. One of the spices used to make rawon is kluwek or keluak, which gives it a black color.  The specialty of rawon which is usually eaten with rice is the addition of rawon chili sauce. Like a match, rawon will never be complete without chili sauce,  short bean sprouts, fried onions, and don't miss the crackers, both shrimp crackers and white crackers. The slightly sweet taste of the sauce will make this black soup a delicious

steps: with 3-4 tablespoons of oil, stir-fry spiced paste, keluak, galangal, and all the Leaf until fragrant
Add meat, stir until stiff.
Pour the water keluak and 1 liter of water. Bring to a boil.
Reduce the heat, cook until the meat is tender and the remaining gravy + 800 ml.
Ready to be served with the accompaniment

items.name: Keluak
items.description: Soak, strain and puree. Marinated water set aside

foods.name: Lontong Cap Gomeh
foods.description: Lontong Cap Go Meh is an adaptation of the Chinese Indonesian community to local Indonesian cuisine, especially in Java.  Lontong Cap Go Meh is believed to be a food that brings good luck, such as dense lontong which is the opposite of porridge which is not eaten when celebrating Chinese New Year.  The long shape of the rice cake is also considered to symbolize a long life. Eggs in various cultures are also believed to be a symbol of good luck, while coconut milk and spices with turmeric are believed to be symbols of gold and luck.

steps: Wash rice, boil until water is absorbed or half cooked (diaron).
Lift. Bring large amounts of water to a boil, using a large saucepan.
Take 2 banana leaves, stack. Put 2-3 tablespoons of aron rice.
Reduce the heat, cook until the meat is tender and the remaining gravy + 800 ml.
Do this step until the rice aron runs out.
Put raw lontong in a pot of boiling water.
Make sure the rice cake is submerged. Boil for about 4 hours over medium heat, stirring occasionally.
If cooked, remove the rice cake from the water. Drain, put on a stand so the water can easily escape. Cool, then cut according to taste
Heat oil, saute spices paste, lemon grass, bay leaf and lime leaves. Saute until fragrant and the spices are cooked.
Add chicken and water, mix well and cook until chicken is cooked and tender.
Season with salt, pepper and sugar according to individual taste.
Add thick coconut milk, stir well and cook until boiling.
Serve with a sprinkling of fried shallots
With 3-5 tablespoons of cooking oil, saute spiced paste until fragrant.
Add red chilies and cook until wilted. Give + 100 ml of water. Reduce the heat and cook + 10 minutes until the gravy is bright red.
Add the liver, gizzard, eggs, coconut milk, shrimp, tamarind water, salt and sugar.
Cook over low heat, stirring occasionally, until gizzard and liver are cooked.
Ready to serve.  Sprinkle with fried shallot.
Stir chayote pieces with salt and let stand for + 10 minutes. Rinse clean and set aside.
While stirring, bring the thin coconut milk to a boil along with the ground spices, salam leaf, and galangal.
Add tempeh and chayote. Cook over medium heat, stirring occasionally.
Reduce heat and add green chilies, long beans, thick coconut milk, salt and 1 tsp brown sugar. Stir until it boils again.
Ready to Serve

foods.name: Ketan Srikaya
foods.description: A steamed soft glutinous rice coated with smooth coconut milk custard is Ketan Srikaya, an Indonesian traditional sweet snack or dessert. Traditional food from West Sumatra.

steps: Wash the soaked glutinous rice again until clean.
In a saucepan, boil coconut milk, water, pandan leaves, and salt until it boils.
Add the glutinous rice to the coconut milk. Cook until the coconut milk is absorbed.
Steam the glutinous rice in a pot/steam until cooked. Set a side.
Boil brown sugar, water, and pandan leaves until everything dissolves like syrup. Remove and cool.
In a bowl, add brown sugar syrup, beaten eggs, coconut milk, and rice flour. Stir until well blended.
Prepare the mold. Give a banana leaf or plastic mat. Grease with a little oil.
Put the sticky rice into the tin and press until smooth. Make sure the sticky rice is really solid.
Pour the sarikaya over the sticky rice while straining. Flatten to cover the entire surface.
Prepare a steamer/pot. Steam the pan for 40-45 minutes until the juice layer is solid. Remove and cool.
Cut into pieces and ready to serve.

items.name: Glutinous Rice
items.description: Wash and soak in water for at least 2 hours

foods.name: Lawar
foods.description: Lawar is a versatile Balinese meal made with coconut, chili powder, shrimp paste, kaffir lime leaves, galangal, and turmeric, and commonly consists of minced meat and vegetables. Lawar is traditionally cooked with pork or turtle, but it can also be made with chicken, duck, or beef.

steps: Saute ground spices with 3 tablespoons of oil until fragrant.
Add shredded chicken, grated coconut, salt and sugar.
Remove, let cool, and give lime juice.
Mix with the vegetables.  Ready to serve

foods.name: Sambal Goreng Hati Kentang
foods.description: Sambal Goreng hati kentang is one of the typical foods on Eid day. and often also a complementary food in Nasi Tumpeng.

steps: Peel the potatoes and cut them into small cubes.
Wash the beef liver and cut into small cubes.
Fry the potatoes and beef liver separately until slightly dry. Lift and drain.
Spiced Paste: Boil red chilies, red cayenne pepper, shallots and garlic until soft and then drain.
Puree the boiled spices with the shrimp paste, sugar and salt.
Heat 5 tbsp oil in a frying pan. Saute ground spices until fragrant.
Enter the bay leaf, galangal, and sliced ​​red chili, stir until wilted.
Pour coconut milk and bring to a boil.
Add the fried potatoes and liver. Cook over low heat until the coconut milk and spices are reduced, almost dry. Lift.

foods.name: Sambal Matah
foods.description: Sambal Matah is a raw Indonesian sambal that hails from Bali. Sambal is an Indian and South Asian condiment made from a combination of fiery chilies and fresh aromatics such as shallots and ginger. Serve as a relish with noodles or fried rice, or as a side dish with fish, steak, or fritters.

steps: Heat the oil, then fry the shrimp paste until fragrant. Remove and let it warm.
Then, add the onion, garlic, cayenne pepper, and lemongrass. Stir until fragrant.
Then add salt and lime juice, mix well.
Sambal matah Bali is ready to be served

items.name: Lemongrass Stalk
items.description: Take the white part, sliced finely

foods.name: Es Dawet
foods.description: Es dawet comes from Banjarnegara, Central Java. Made from rice flour, and to produce a green color, using suji leaf juice. Es dawet has a soft and smooth texture and is usually added with ‘Tape ketan’ to serve it.

steps: Mix rice flour, tapioca flour, pandan leaves and water. Stir well. Boiled until thickened.
Prepare a container of cold water and ice cubes. Print using a cendol mold.
Boil coconut milk, pandan leaves and salt until it boils while continuously stirring so that the coconut milk does not break. Remove and cool. Set aside
Brown sugar solution: Boil water, brown sugar and white sugar until it boils. Stir well. Remove and cool.
Prepare a glass, then add brown sugar syrup, dawet, add shaved ice then add with the coconut milk sauce
Dawet Ayu ice is ready to be served.

foods.name: Ayam Sisit/Pelalah
foods.description: Pelalah chicken is a Balinese dish with a pungent, spicy flavor. Boiling, grilled, or ungkep chicken with a mixture of ground spices will be cooked in one of three ways: boiled, grilled, or ungkep. The chicken meat will then be shredded and properly combined with chili seasoning before being served.

steps: Coat the chicken with a mixture of tablespoons of fried pepper, turmeric and 1 teaspoon of salt. Leave it for 1 hour
After that transfer to a heat-resistant container, and bake for 1 hour at 150 degrees C/ until cooked. Remove and set aside.
Shredded.
With 3 tablespoons of oil, saute ground spices and all the leaves until fragrant.
Add shredded chicken, tamarind water and sugar.
Cook until the water runs out. Add lime juice. Stir again and lift
Ready to be served

foods.name: Sate Lilit
foods.description: Sate lilit is an Indonesian satay variation that originated in Balinese cuisine. Minced pork, fish, chicken, beef, or even turtle meat is blended with grated coconut, thick coconut milk, lemon juice, shallots, and pepper to make this satay. Spiced minced beef is wrapped in bamboo, sugar cane, or lemongrass sticks and roasted over charcoal.

steps: Saute spiced paste with 3 tablespoons of oil until fragrant.
Add tamarind water and sugar. Stir and set a side.
Cooling down, add fish, shrimp, coconut milk and lime leaves. Mix well and divide into 6 parts
Tighten each piece of dough at the base of the lemongrass, roast it over the coals until it is cooked, the sambal is flipped over and smeared with cooking oil/ thick coconut milk
Ready to serve

foods.name: Malbi
foods.description: Malbi is known as a typical ‘Semur Palembang’. Because the appearance and seasoning are similar to semur.  It tastes sweet and savory and goes well with chili sauce and rice.  The main ingredient of this malbi is beef cooked with spices such as cinnamon, cardamom, cloves, tamarind and several other spices.

items: Grated coconut dry fry until browned, pounded until oily. Set aside
Saute ground spices with 3 tablespoons of oil until fragrant.
Add meat, mix well. Enter the grated roasted coconut that has been pounded, stir and pour 500-750 ml of water.
Reduce the heat and stir occasionally, turning it over until the meat is tender and the gravy thickens.
Add sweet soy sauce and tamarind water.
Served and sprinkle with fried shallot
